1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		utilmem.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/28					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
11   |  ** 									     **
12   |  **   Description:	Broke out the memory handling routines used by	     **
13   |  **			the module code.				     **
14   |  ** 									     **
15   |  **   Exports:		module_malloc					     **
16   |  **			module_realloc					     **
17   |  **			module_calloc					     **
18   |  **			null_free					     **
19   |  **			stringer					     **
20   |  **									     **

22   |  ****/

31   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: utilmem.c.src.html,v 1.1 2009/09/01 20:22:37 rkowen Exp $";
32   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
33   | 
34   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
36   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
37   | 
38   | #include "modules_def.h"
39   | 
40   | /*++++
41   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
42   |  ** 									     **
43   |  **   Function:		module_malloc					     **
44   |  ** 									     **
45   |  **   Description:	A wrapper for the system malloc() function,	     **
46   |  ** 			so the argument can be tested and set to a positive  **
47   |  ** 			value.						     **
48   |  ** 									     **
49   |  **   First Edition:	2007/02/14					     **
50   |  ** 									     **
51   |  **   Parameters:	size_t	size		Number of bytes to allocate  **
52   |  ** 									     **
53   |  **   Result:		void    *		An allocated memory pointer  **
54   |  ** 									     **
55   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
56   |  ++++*/
57   | 
58   | #define USE_CKALLOC
59   | 
60   | void *module_malloc(size_t size) {
61   | 
62   | #ifdef USE_CKALLOC
63   | 	Tcl_ValidateAllMemory(__FILE__,__LINE__);
64   | 	return ckalloc(size > 0 ? size : 1);
65   | #else
66   | 	return malloc(size > 0 ? size : 1);
67   | #endif
68   | 
69   | } /** End of 'module_malloc' **/
70   | 
71   | /*++++
72   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Function:		module_realloc					     **
75   |  ** 									     **
76   |  **   Description:	A wrapper for the system realloc() function,	     **
77   |  ** 			so the argument can be tested and set to a positive  **
78   |  ** 			value.						     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/22					     **
81   |  ** 									     **
82   |  **   Parameters:	char *	ptr		Memory to reallocate	     **
83   |  **   			size_t	size		Number of bytes to allocate  **
84   |  ** 									     **
85   |  **   Result:		void    *		An allocated memory pointer  **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
88   |  ++++*/
89   | 
90   | void *module_realloc(void *ptr, size_t size) {
91   | 
92   | #ifdef USE_CKALLOC
93   | 	return ckrealloc(ptr, size > 0 ? size : 1);
94   | #else
95   | 	return realloc(ptr, size > 0 ? size : 1);
96   | #endif
97   | 
98   | } /** End of 'module_realloc' **/
99   | 
100  | /*++++
101  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
102  |  ** 									     **
103  |  **   Function:		module_calloc					     **
104  |  ** 									     **
105  |  **   Description:	A wrapper for the system calloc() function,	     **
106  |  ** 			so the argument can be tested and set to a positive  **
107  |  ** 			value.						     **
108  |  ** 									     **
109  |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/22					     **
110  |  ** 									     **
111  |  **   Parameters:	size_t	size		Number of bytes to allocate  **
112  |  ** 									     **
113  |  **   Result:		void    *		An allocated memory pointer  **
114  |  ** 									     **
115  |  **   Parameters:	size_t	nmemb		Number of bytes of member    **
116  |  **   			size_t	size		Number of bytes to allocate  **
117  |  ** 									     **
118  |  **   Result:		void    *		An allocated memory pointer  **
119  |  ** 									     **
120  |  ** 									     **
121  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
122  |  ++++*/
123  | 
124  | void *module_calloc(size_t nmemb, size_t size) {
125  | 
126  | 	void * ptr = NULL;
127  | 
128  | 	size = (size > 0 ? size : 1);
129  | 	ptr = module_malloc(nmemb * size);
130  | 
131  | 	return memset(ptr, '\0', nmemb * size);
132  | 
133  | } /** End of 'module_calloc' **/
134  | 
135  | /*++++
136  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
137  |  ** 									     **
138  |  **   Function:		null_free					     **
139  |  ** 									     **
140  |  **   Description:	does a free and then nulls the pointer.		     **
141  |  ** 									     **
142  |  **   First Edition:	2000/08/24					     **
143  |  ** 									     **
144  |  **   parameters:	void	**var		allocated memory	     **
145  |  ** 									     **
146  |  **   result:		void    		(nothing)		     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   attached globals:	-						     **
149  |  ** 									     **
150  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
151  |  ++++*/
152  | 
153  | void null_free(void ** var) {
154  | 
155  | 	if (! *var) return;	/* passed in a NULL ptr */
156  | 
157  | #ifdef USE_FREE
158  | #  ifdef USE_CKALLOC
159  | 	ckfree( *var);
160  | #  else
161  | 	free( *var);
162  | #  endif
163  | #endif
164  | 	*var = NULL;
165  | 
166  | } /** End of 'null_free' **/
167  | 
168  | /*++++
169  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
170  |  ** 									     **
171  |  **   Function:		stringer					     **
172  |  ** 									     **
173  |  **   Description:	Safely copies and concats series of strings	     **
174  |  **			until it hits a NULL argument.			     **
175  |  **			Either a buffer & length are given or if the buffer  **
176  |  **			pointer is NULL then it will allocate memory to the  **
177  |  **			given length. If the length is 0 then get the length **
178  |  **			from the series of strings.			     **
179  |  **			The resultant buffer is returned unless there	     **
180  |  **			is an error then NULL is returned.		     **
181  |  **			(Therefore, one of the main uses of stringer is to   **
182  |  **			 allocate string memory.)			     **
183  |  ** 									     **
184  |  ** 									     **
185  |  **   First Edition:	2001/08/08	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
186  |  ** 									     **
187  |  **   Parameters:	char		*buffer	string buffer (if not NULL)  **
188  |  **			int		 len	maximum length of buffer     **
189  |  **			const char	*str1	1st string to copy to buffer **
190  |  **			const char	*str2	2nd string to cat  to buffer **
191  |  ** 			...						     **
192  |  **			const char	*strN	Nth string to cat  to buffer **
193  |  **			const char	*NULL	end of arguments	     **
194  |  ** 									     **
195  |  **   Result:		char		*buffer	if successful completion    **
196  |  ** 					else NULL			     **
197  |  ** 									     **
198  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
199  |  ** 									     **
200  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
201  |  ++++*/
202  | 
203  | char *stringer(	char *		buffer,
204  | 		int		len,
205  | 		... )
206  | {
207  | 	va_list	 argptr;	/** stdarg argument ptr			**/
208  | 	char	*ptr;		/** argument string ptr			**/
209  | 	char	*tbuf = buffer;	/** tempory buffer  ptr			**/
210  | 	int	 sumlen = 0;	/** length of all the concat strings	**/
211  | 	char	*(*strfn)(char*,const char*) = strcpy;
212  | 				/** ptr to 1st string function		**/
213  | 
214  | 	/* get start of optional arguments and sum string lengths */
215  | 	va_start(argptr, len);
216  | 	while ((ptr = va_arg(argptr, char *))) {
217  | 		sumlen += strlen(ptr);
218  | 	}
219  | 	va_end(argptr);
220  | 
221  | 	/* can we even proceed? */
222  | 	if (tbuf && (sumlen >= len || len < 0)) {
223  | 		return (char *) NULL;
224  | 	}
225  | 
226  | 	/* do we need to allocate memory? */
227  | 	if (tbuf == (char *) NULL) {
228  | 		if (len == 0) {
229  | 			len = sumlen + 1;
230  | 		}
231  | 		if ((char *) NULL == (tbuf = (char*) module_malloc(len))) {
232  | 			return (char *) NULL;
233  | 		}
234  | 	}
235  | 
236  | 	/* concat all the strings to buffer */
237  | 	va_start(argptr, len);
238  | 	while ((ptr = va_arg(argptr, char *))) {
239  | 		strfn(tbuf, ptr);
240  | 		strfn = strcat;
241  | 	}
242  | 	va_end(argptr);
243  | 
244  | 	/* got here successfully - return buffer */
245  | 	return tbuf;
246  | 
247  | } /** End of 'stringer' **/
